title.narrative: Fight against discrimination, hate crimes and hate speech in Georgia

description.narrative:
Denmark supports Georgia in its endeavors to fight discrimination, hate crime and hate speech. The engagement builds on strategic national priorities and legislation, on the priorities of the beneficiary partners, the country's international commitments and the EU and Council of Europe standards. The engagement supports the full range in the flow of justice, from improved legislation and policies, enhanced capacity of the justice sector and human rights institutions and awareness raising.
The intervention is undertaken in partnership with the Council of Europe, which works to capacitate and facilitate joint efforts of key state institutions in this area. The Council of Europe is a strong partner in this intervention, selected based on the organisations' mandate and track record for working with the human rights agenda in Georgia for multiple years. The intervention entails cooperation between the Council of Europe and numerous national institutions and civil society organisations.
